drag_drop: Drag and drop a PDF here or use the file upload button.
reference_fail: Reference identification unsuccesful. Please go to the settings tab.
no_cookies: This site does not use cookies. Just letting you know!
privacy_text: This site does not use cookies...
faq_q1: 1. What is this software, and what does it do?
faq_a1: This software checks citation accuracy in PDFs, ensuring in-text citations match the reference list. It verifies each reference through CrossRef and lets users search Google Scholar for accuracy.
faq_q2: 2. How do I use the software?
faq_a2: Upload your PDF, and the software will guide you through citation settings. After the analysis is complete, you’ll see an overview of any mismatched in-text citations and references in your document.
faq_a3: The software detects citations and references following the APA style. The results for other reference styles are currently not reliable. Matching may work for other reference styles similar to APA.
faq_q4: 4. What is the level of accuracy, and what happens if there’s a mismatch?
faq_a4: While we strive for high accuracy, we cannot guarantee 100% precision, as there is always a chance of mismatches due to limitations in analyzing PDF text and detecting citations and references. If the software detects a mismatch, it will highlight the discrepancy, allowing the user to manually verify and match in-text citations and references.
faq_q5: 5. Can Citalyze detect AI-generated false references?
faq_a5: Yes. Many AI text generators invent references or mix real with false sources. Citalyze compares each reference against the CrossRef database and flags those that do not exist or contain incorrect details.
header_footer_both: We found a header and a footer in the PDF. Check/Uncheck the boxes below to manually set the header and footer sections.
header_footer_header_only: We found a header in the PDF. Check/Uncheck the boxes below to manually set the header and footer sections.
header_footer_footer_only: We found a footer in the PDF. Check/Uncheck the boxes below to manually set the header and footer sections.
header_footer_none: We found no footer or header in the PDF. Check/Uncheck the boxes below to manually set the header and footer sections.
start_ref_found: Reference section found and highlighted. For manually resetting, click button below.
start_ref_missing: No reference section found. Please select start of section manually by clicking button below.
end_ref_found: Reference section found and highlighted. For manually resetting, click button below.
end_ref_missing: No reference section found. Please select end of section manually by clicking button below.
start_ref_click: Click above the first reference in the reference section to manually reset start.
end_ref_click: Click below the last reference in the reference section to manually reset end.
ref_sep_stats: {{paragraphCount}} references found by paragraph separation, {{indentCount}} by indent separation.
ref_sep_suggest_paragraph: We suggest to separate by paragraphs. Click below to change the reference separation algorithm.
ref_sep_suggest_indent: We suggest to separate by indents. Click below to change the reference separation algorithm.
tooltip_reference_list:
Reference List Overview
Here, users can view all detected references from the reference list. An entry may look like this:
  • Linked in-text citations are shown if a match is found. These citations are clickable and direct you to their location in the document.
  • References with a red border indicate that no in-text citation match was found.
  • Each reference includes a 'best match' section from the Crossref database to help verify the accuracy of the entry in the reference list.
  • A click on will open a Google Scholar search with the detected reference.
citations_without_match: Found {{unmatched}} in-text citations without match ({{total}} total)
tooltip_found:
Identified in-text citation: {{citation}}
Successfully matched with reference!
tooltip_not_found:
Identified in-text citation: {{citation}}
No matching reference found! Click for suggestions and assign manually by dragging this element onto the respective reference.
tooltip_ambig:
Identified in-text citation: {{citation}}
Found more than one matching reference! Click for suggestions and reassign manually by dragging this element onto the respective reference.
tooltip_year:
Identified in-text citation: {{citation}}
Check publication year! Reassign manually by dragging this element onto the respective reference.
tooltip_typo:
Identified in-text citation: {{citation}}
Check spelling! Reassign manually by dragging this element onto the respective reference.
tooltip_intext_issues:
In-Text Citation Issues
Here you find all identified in-text citations that show problems when matched against the reference list. Problems can be:
  • Author Year In-text citations without a matching reference in the reference list. You can manually match these by dragging and dropping the citation onto the corresponding entry in the reference list below.
  • Author Year In-text citations with a matching reference, but containing typos or incorrect publication years. You can manually match these by dragging and dropping the citation onto the corresponding entry in the reference list below.
  • Author Year In-text citations matched through abbreviations.
